bibl.title: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, October 31, 1900

div1.p: Reed reports his duties for the month of October 1900.

div1.head: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, October 31, 1900
div1.opener:
All communications to this Office should be addressed “To the Surgeon General, U. S. Army, Washington, D. C.”
Subject: Station & Duty.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
Surgeon General's Office,
U. S. Army Medical Museum and Library,
Corner 7th and B Streets SW.,
Washington, October 31, 1900. ,
TO THE ADJUTANT GENERAL,
U. S. Army.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to report that during the month of October,
1900, I have been on duty as follows:

From Oct. 1st to 13th at Camp Columbia, Quemados, Cuba, per S.O. 122,
Par 34, A.G.O., Washington, May 24, 1900; Oct. 14th to 20 en route to
U.S. per letter of instruction of Commanding General, Division of Cuba,
Oct. 12, 1900; Oct. 21st to 27th in attendance as delegate to American
Public Health Association at Indianapolis, Ind., per S.O. No. 246, Par.
25, A.G.O., Washington, Oct. 19, 1900; Oct. 28th to 31st awaiting the
departure of steamer for Cuba en route to duty at Camp Columbia, Que-
mados, Cuba.
note ary
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Walter Reed, Major, Surgeon U.S. Army.
(over)

div1.head: Handwritten note by [Philip Showalter Hench], [n.d.]
div1.p:
I dont believe this report is entirely
accurate. I think Reed got to
Wash before Oct 20.

According to Reed's were to Sternberg
(Oct 12) he was leaving Cuba Oct 13
according to Sternbergs letter of Oct 19
to A.G. Reed was “now in this city”
according to WR's letter of 13 Oct
to wife he would be in D.C. not
later than evening of 18 Oct.
